thread.title: Tree memorializing shooting victims cut down overnight
thread.title_full: Tree memorializing shooting victims cut down overnight | Albuquerque Journal News

author: Associated Press
title: Tree memorializing shooting victims cut down overnight
text:
BOULDER, Colo. — A tree memorializing two shooting victims was cut down in Longmont sometime Thursday night or early Friday morning.
The Boulder Daily Camera reports ( http://bit.ly/1jtJ8jB) 40-year-old Sean Griffin and 41-year-old Staci Froderman Griffin were killed in their Boulder flooring store in 2010 by 50-year-old employee Robert P. Montgomery, who then shot himself.
The Griffins’ daughter was 12 years old at the time of the shooting. Friends of hers planted the tree in the Longmont neighborhood of Prospect, where the family lived.
Prospect developer Kiki Wallace says a nearby bench clearly marks the tree as a memorial.
Longmont police Cmdr. Jeff Satur said neither the city of Longmont nor the property owners claim responsibility for the felled tree.
___
Information from: Daily Camera, http://www.dailycamera.com/
